lines.gurmukhi: jYsy eyk smY dRum sPl spqR pun eyk smY PUl Pl pqR igr jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ayk Samai Droum Sadhal Sapatr Pouna , Ayk Samai Dhool Dhal Patr Gir Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tree is full of fruits and leaves at one time and then at another time, all leaves, fruits etc. fall off.

lines.gurmukhi: sirqw silil jYsy kbhUM smwn bhY kbhUM AQwh Aq pRbil idKwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saritaa Salili Jaisay Kabahoon Samaan Bahai , Kabahoon Adaah At Prabali Dikhaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a stream flows calmly at a place but at another place it is rapid and noisy.

lines.gurmukhi: eyk smY jYsy hIrw hoq jIrnwNbr mY eyk smY kMcn jVy jgmgwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ayk Samai Jaisay Heeraa Hot Jeeranaanbar Mai , Ayk Samai Kanchan Jarhay Jagamagaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a diamond is wrapped in a (silk) rag at one time. but at another time, the same diamond is inlaid in gold and shines with its grandeur.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK rwjkumwr jogIsur hY mwieAwDwrI BwrI jog jugq jugwq hY ]497]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Raajakoumaar Jogeesur Hai , Maaiaadhaaree Bhaaree Jog Jougat Jougaat Hai ?497?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, an obedient Sikh of the Guru is a prince at one time and a supreme ascetic at another time. Even when he is wealthy, he still remains absorbed in the methods of realisation of the Lord.  (497)
